data.title: Error with babel plugin transform-export-extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

I'm use babel plugin "transform-export-extensions"
In order to do re-export - export default from './foo';
but I have error [js] ';' expected.
It can be fixed?

or maybe add  a shortcut ex:

To jump navigation (focus) on breakPoint ?
i have a plugin with more than 1000 line , and is hard to jump to line i need.
how i can jump to eatch break point in my file ?

is not possible, it can be a nice feature to add.

data.title: We need some way of differentiating roots with the same basename
data.body:
From @doublehelix in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/396#issuecomment-311867661

> When I add two "root" folders with the samename from two separate projects, there is nothing to distinguish these folders apart.
> 
> e.g. I add `/dev/www/myproject/src` and then add `/dev/libraries/mycomponent/src`
> All I see is two root folders called `src`.
> ```
> > src
> > src
> ```
> I believe we need a way to change the *display name* of the root folders.
> Which would then display:
> ```
> > My Project (/src)
> > Component 1 (/src)
> ```

Perhaps we could leverage the code that does differentiates files for tabs (eg. /a/b/c, /d/b/c becomes /a/.../c, /d/.../c).

data.title: Syntax highlighting of JavaScript code in Template Literals
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|ng-template|Angular|0.1.4|
|tslint|eg2|0.16.0|;

---

If js code is written in a template literal, the text that would normally be white (the default color) is orange (the color of the rest of the string).

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a template literal, add any code to a placeholder, eg
```javascript
`A string, ${[1, 2, 3].join(',')}`
```
2. The `[`,`]`,`.`,`,`,`(`, and `)` will be colored orange when they should not be.

data.title: Git gutters don't show when you Uppercase a filename

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|azurenodeessentials|azuresdkteam|0.2.6|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.6.24|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.1.1|
|minify|HookyQR|0.3.0|
|ftp-sync|lukasz-wronski|0.3.3|
|yo|samverschueren|0.9.3|
|vscode-wakatime|WakaTime|1.1.12|
|vsc-jsonsnippets|wmontalvo|0.1.4|;


---

Git gutter doesn't show when you Uppercase a filename (partial or full)

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Add some code to an existing repository and rename the filename with an Uppercase (in the screenshot app.js -> App.js)
2.The git gutters disappear and the Source Control tab stage the changes with the old filename (app.js instead of App.js)
3. Commit the staged changes
4. Add some code to the renamed file
5. Git gutters doesn't show again but the Working Tree looks good
6. If you rename the files as before (App.js -> app.js) the git gutters appear correctly

![img_003842-2017-06-29 14_16_14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26719977/27691351-101b1720-5ce4-11e7-9b63-a32f7195fc4c.png)
![img_003843-2017-06-29 14_16_52](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26719977/27691353-1020fbcc-5ce4-11e7-93a4-a20d6536b508.png)
![img_003844-2017-06-29 14_17_13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26719977/27691352-101ebe34-5ce4-11e7-9d66-87607145b198.png)
![img_003845-2017-06-29 14_17_58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26719977/27691354-1022bac0-5ce4-11e7-9a1a-cc907a242d32.png)
![img_003846-2017-06-29 14_18_07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26719977/27691355-1027515c-5ce4-11e7-95f3-43b5fb3fc9b7.png)
![img_003847-2017-06-29 14_18_56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26719977/27691356-102a7260-5ce4-11e7-807e-68e78cc0784f.png)

data.title: Fix for #29608 'QuickOpen looks misaligned in monokai theme'.
data.body: Changed the 'widget.shadow' property of the monokai theme to #00000 so that it does not blend in with any of the backgrounds.

data.title: Fixes #29729
No launch.json created after selecting 'Node' as the target
data.body:
1) open a workspace on an empty folder
2) press F5
3) quick pick shows 'Node' as an option
4) select 'Node'

Nothing happens and no launch.json is created for node debugging.

data.title: Emmet 2.0 "wrap with abbreviation" bug when partial line is selected
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (954193248183c7bb4d70c89898bc5337ce57fe98, 2017-06-29T05:07:31.424Z) - OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0 - Extensions: Extension|Author (truncated)|Version ---|---|--- ng-template|Ang|0.1.4 vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.9.1 code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.1 sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0 Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2 project-manager|ale|0.18.1 path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2 vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11 vscode-html-css|ecm|0.1.7 tslint|eg2|0.16.0 auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14 Angular2|joh|2.3.3 ecdc|mit|0.10.3 HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3 vscode-stylefmt|mrm|2.4.1 angular2-inline|nat|0.0.17 stylelint|shi|0.26.0 ayu|tea|0.4.0 change-case|wma|1.0.0 (4 theme extensions excluded) --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Take this fragment of html: `

NG-Bootstrap Popovers

` 2. Select the word "Popovers" 3. Invoke "Emmet > Wrap with Abbreviation" 4. type "code" to wrap word with the `` tag 5. Result is `

NG-Bootstrap

NG-Bootstrap Popovers

` ![jun-29-2017 09-25-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/835148/27689770-4c640462-5cad-11e7-83f5-f6c85cf2c067.gif) Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Pre & Post callbacks per task for Tasks Runner

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Copy from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/20446#issuecomment-305289878

------

Is possible to subscribe to `onDidTaskRun()`, where would be an ability to catch up some tasks and perform some operations? We have `pre` and `post` callbacks in Atom Build for each task. 

Simple use case. User open @platformio Serial Monitor via integrated Terminal, we see it. He triggers "Upload" task, we temporary close opened Serial Port Monitors/Terminals, then uploading firmware. If a task fails with an error, we don't re-open Monitor. However, if the upload was successful, we re-open last Serial Port Monitor.

Thanks for the hints!

data.title: Set default clone parent directory in configuration
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

When cloning a repository from Git, VSC always proposes the user home directory as parent directory for the clone.

Feature request: A user configuration option which allows choosing another default parent directory.

data.title: Search activity bar should show progress badge while search is in progress

All other activities in the activity bar show a progress badge while the viewlet is busy.
This is not the case with the search viewlet
